text:
event log says:-
The Apache service named Apache2Triad Apache2 Service reported the following 
error:
>>> httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 1076 of C:/apache2triad/conf/httpd.conf: 
Cannot load C:/apache2triad/modules/mod_perl.so into server: A dynamic link 
library (DLL) initialization routine failed.     .
creator: mukeshhrs@yahoo.com

text:
Are you using a mod_perl that had been build against 2.2.x or are you using one
that had been build against 2.0.x? 2.2.x and 2.0.x are binary incompatible. So
you need to use a mod_perl that has been build against 2.2.x.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
timorhatamy@hotmail.com
text:
With the newest Apache version 2.2.4 there is no mod_perl.so file in the 
<modules> directory and compiling a new one with perl is also rejected by 
Apache server. If there is any working “mod_perl.so” module file for the 2.2.4 
version, please add the downloading URL to it hare.
This would help may I’m  sure : )
If this is a bug or not… This is the main open question.

This isn't mod_perl's bug tracking - it's httpd's.  Closing.

Start off again at http://perl.apache.org/ for more info.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
